snippet: Protesters in Albuquerque threw fake arrest warrants at the police chief on Monday, prompting the City Council to end debate on a charter amendment that would transfer authority for picking the police chief from the mayor to voters.
abstract: Protest in Albuquerque prompts the City Council to end debate on a charter amendment that would transfer authority for picking the police chief from the mayor to voters; comes two days after an officer fatally shot a man, 25th person killed by Albuquerque police since January 2010.
lead_paragraph: Protesters in Albuquerque threw fake arrest warrants at the police chief on Monday, prompting the City Council to end debate on a charter amendment that would transfer authority for picking the police chief from the mayor to voters.

headline.main: New Mexico: New Protests Against Albuquerque Police
headline.print_headline: New Mexico: New Protests Against Albuquerque Police
